If the user was immune to ground attacks, it will now take normal damage from them. roar and whirlwind will not affect the user. The user cannot use magnet rise. The user may still use u turn to leave the field. This effect can be passed with baton pass.
status.desc: The user lays roots that restore its HP on every turn. Because it’s rooted, it can’t switch out.

status.name: Magic Coat
status.effect: The first non damaging move targeting the user this turn that inflicts major status effects, stat changes, or trapping effects will be reflected at its user. defog, memento, and teeter dance are not reflected. attract, flatter, gastro acid, leech seed, swagger, worry seed, and yawn are reflected. This move cannot be copied by mirror move.
status.desc: A barrier reflects back to the target moves like Leech Seed and moves that damage status.

status.name: Recycle
status.effect: User recovers the last item consumed by the user or a Pokémon in its position on the field. The item must be used again before it can be recovered by this move again. If the user is holding an item, this move fails. Items taken or given away by covet, knock off, switcheroo, thief, or trick may not be recovered.
status.desc: The user recycles a held item that has been used in battle so it can be used again.

status.name: Yawn
status.effect: Puts the target to sleep at the end of the next turn. Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers. If the target leaves the field, this effect is canceled. If the target has a status effect when this move is used, this move will fail. If the target is protected by safeguard when this move is used, this move will fail. insomnia and vital spirit prevent the sleep if the target has either at the end of the next turn, but will not cause this move to fail on use.
status.desc: The user lets loose a huge yawn that lulls the target into falling asleep on the next turn.

status.name: Skill Swap
status.effect: User and target switch abilities. Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers. If either Pokémon has multitype or wonder guard, this move will fail.
status.desc: The user employs its psychic power to exchange Abilities with the target.

status.name: Imprison
status.effect: Prevents any Pokémon on the opposing side of the field from using any move the user knows until the user leaves the field. This effect is live; if the user obtains new moves while on the field, these moves become restricted. If no opposing Pokémon knows any of the user's moves when this move is used, this move will fail.
status.desc: If opposing Pokémon know any move also known by the user, they are prevented from using it.

status.name: Refresh
status.effect: Removes a burn, paralysis, or poison from the user.
status.desc: The user rests to cure itself of poisoning, a burn, or paralysis.

status.name: Grudge
status.effect: If the user faints before it next acts, the move that fainted it will have its PP dropped to 0. End of turn damage does not trigger this effect.
status.desc: If the user faints, the user’s grudge fully depletes the PP of the opponent’s move that knocked it out.

status.name: Snatch
status.effect: The next time a Pokémon uses a beneficial move on itself or itself and its ally this turn, the user of this move will steal the move and use it itself. Moves which may be stolen by this move are identified by the "snatchable" flag. If two Pokémon use this move on the same turn, the faster Pokémon will steal the first beneficial move, and the slower Pokémon will then steal it again—thus, only the slowest Pokémon using this move ultimately gains a stolen move's effect. If the user steals psych up, it will target the Pokémon that used psych up. If the user was the original target of psych up, and the Pokémon that originally used it's affected by pressure, it will only lose 1 PP. This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.
status.desc: The user steals the effects of any attempts to use a healing or stat changing move.

status.name: Camouflage
status.effect: User's type changes according to the terrain. Terrain | New type | Building | normal Cave | rock Desert | ground Grass | grass Mountain | rock Ocean | water Pond | water Road | ground Snow | ice Tall grass | grass In Pokémon Battle Revolution: Terrain | New type | Courtyard | normal Crystal | rock Gateway | water Magma | rock Main Street | normal Neon | normal Stargazer | rock Sunny Park | grass Sunset | ground Waterfall | grass
status.desc: The user’s type is changed depending on its environment, such as at water’s edge, in grass, or in a cave.

status.name: Tail Glow
status.effect: Raises the user's Special Attack by three stages.
status.desc: The user stares at flashing lights to focus its mind, drastically raising its Sp. Atk stat.

status.name: Feather Dance
status.effect: Lowers the target's Attack by two stages.
status.desc: The user covers the target’s body with a mass of down that harshly lowers its Attack stat.

status.name: Teeter Dance
status.effect: Confuses all targets.
status.desc: The user performs a wobbly dance that confuses the Pokémon around it.

status.name: Mud Sport
status.effect: electric moves inflict half damage, regardless of target. If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.
status.desc: The user kicks up mud on the battlefield. This weakens Electric type moves for five turns.

status.name: Slack Off
status.effect: Heals the user for half its max HP.
status.desc: The user slacks off, restoring its own HP by up to half of its max HP.

status.name: Aromatherapy
status.effect: Removes major status effects and confusion from every Pokémon in the user's party.
status.desc: The user releases a soothing scent that heals all status conditions affecting the user’s party.

status.name: Fake Tears
status.effect: Lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.
status.desc: The user feigns crying to fluster the target, harshly lowering its Sp. Def stat.

status.name: Odor Sleuth
status.effect: Resets the target's evasion to normal and prevents any further boosting until the target leaves the field. A ghost under this effect takes normal damage from normal and fighting moves. This move itself ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
status.desc: Enables a Ghost type target to be hit by Normal and Fighting type attacks. This also enables an evasive target to be hit.

status.name: Metal Sound
status.effect: Lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.
status.desc: A horrible sound like scraping metal harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Def stat.

status.name: Grass Whistle
status.effect: Puts the target to sleep.
status.desc: The user plays a pleasant melody that lulls the target into a deep sleep.

status.name: Tickle
status.effect: Lowers the target's Attack and Defense by one stage.
status.desc: The user tickles the target into laughing, reducing its Attack and Defense stats.

status.name: Cosmic Power
status.effect: Raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage.
status.desc: The user absorbs a mystical power from space to raise its Defense and Sp. Def stats.

status.name: Iron Defense
status.effect: Raises the user's Defense by two stages.
status.desc: The user hardens its body’s surface like iron, sharply raising its Defense stat.

status.name: Block
status.effect: The target cannot switch out normally. Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers. This effect ends when the user leaves the field. The target may still escape by using baton pass, u turn, or a shed shell. Both the user and the target pass on this effect with baton pass.
status.desc: The user blocks the target’s way with arms spread wide to prevent escape.

status.name: Howl
status.effect: Raises the user's Attack by one stage.
status.desc: The user howls loudly to raise its spirit, which raises its Attack stat.

status.name: Bulk Up
status.effect: Raises the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each.
status.desc: The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body, raising both its Attack and Defense stats.

status.name: Water Sport
status.effect: fire moves inflict half damage, regardless of target. If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.
status.desc: The user soaks the battlefield with water. This weakens Fire type moves for five turns.

status.name: Calm Mind
status.effect: Raises the user's Special Attack and Special Defense by one stage each.
status.desc: The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its spirit to raise its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.

status.name: Dragon Dance
status.effect: Raises the user's Attack and Speed by one stage each.
status.desc: The user vigorously performs a mystic, powerful dance that raises its Attack and Speed stats.

status.name: Roost
status.effect: Heals the user for half its max HP. If the user is flying, its flying type is ignored until the end of this turn.
status.desc: The user lands and rests its body. It restores the user’s HP by up to half of its max HP.

status.name: Gravity
status.effect: For five turns (including this one), all immunities to ground moves are disabled. For the duration of this effect, the evasion of every Pokémon on the field is lowered by two stages. Cancels the effects of bounce, fly, and sky drop. Specifically, flying Pokémon and those with levitate or that have used magnet rise are no longer immune to ground attacks, arena trap, spikes, or toxic spikes. bounce, fly, sky drop, high jump kick, jump kick, and splash cannot be used while this move is in effect. *Bug*: If this move is used during a double or triple battle while Pokémon are under the effect of sky drop, Sky Drop's effect is not correctly canceled on its target, and it remains high in the air indefinitely. As Sky Drop prevents the target from acting, the only way to subsequently remove it from the field is to faint it.
status.desc: Enables Flying type Pokémon or Pokémon with the Levitate Ability to be hit by Ground type moves. Flying moves can’t be used.

status.name: Miracle Eye
status.effect: Resets the target's evasion to normal and prevents any further boosting until the target leaves the field. A dark Pokémon under this effect takes normal damage from psychic moves. This move itself ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
status.desc: Enables a Dark type target to be hit by Psychic type attacks. This also enables an evasive target to be hit.

status.name: Healing Wish
status.effect: User faints. Its replacement's HP is fully restored, and any major status effect is removed. If the replacement Pokémon is immediately fainted by a switch in effect, the next replacement is healed by this move instead.
status.desc: The user faints. In return, the Pokémon taking its place will have its HP restored and status conditions cured.

status.name: Tailwind
status.effect: For the next three turns, all Pokémon on the user's side of the field have their original Speed doubled. This effect remains if the user leaves the field.
status.desc: The user whips up a turbulent whirlwind that ups the Speed stat of the user and its allies for four turns.

status.name: Acupressure
status.effect: Raises one of the target's stats by two stages. The raised stat is chosen at random from any stats that can be raised by two stages. If no stat is eligible, this move will fail. If the target has a substitute, this move will have no effect, even if the user is the target. This move cannot be copied by mirror move.
status.desc: The user applies pressure to stress points, sharply boosting one of its or its allies’ stats.

status.name: Embargo
status.effect: Target cannot use its held item for five turns. If the target leaves the field, this effect ends. If a Pokémon under this effect uses bug bite or pluck on a Pokémon holding a berry, the berry is destroyed but not used. If a Pokémon under this effect uses fling, it will fail. This effect is passed by baton pass.
status.desc: This move prevents the target from using its held item for five turns. Its Trainer is also prevented from using items on it.

status.name: Psycho Shift
status.effect: If the user has a major status effect and the target does not, the user's status is transferred to the target.
status.desc: Using its psychic power of suggestion, the user transfers its status conditions to the target.

status.name: Heal Block
status.effect: For the next five turns, the target may not use any moves that only restore HP, and move effects that heal the target are disabled. Moves that steal HP may still be used, but will only inflict damage and not heal the target.
status.desc: For five turns, the user prevents the opposing team from using any moves, Abilities, or held items that recover HP.

status.name: Power Trick
status.effect: The user's original Attack and Defense are swapped. This effect is passed on by baton pass.
status.desc: The user employs its psychic power to switch its Attack stat with its Defense stat.

status.name: Gastro Acid
status.effect: The target's ability is disabled as long as it remains on the field. This effect is passed on by baton pass.
status.desc: The user hurls up its stomach acids on the target. The fluid eliminates the effect of the target’s Ability.

status.name: Lucky Chant
status.effect: For five turns, opposing Pokémon cannot score critical hits.
status.desc: The user chants an incantation toward the sky, preventing opposing Pokémon from landing critical hits for five turns.

status.name: Me First
status.effect: If the target has selected a damaging move this turn, the user will copy that move and use it against the target, with a 50% increase in power. If the target moves before the user, this move will fail. This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.
status.desc: The user cuts ahead of the target to copy and use the target’s intended move with greater power. This move fails if it isn’t used first.

status.name: Copycat
status.effect: Uses the last move that was used successfully by any Pokémon, including the user. This move cannot copy itself, nor roar nor whirlwind. This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.
status.desc: The user mimics the move used immediately before it. The move fails if no other move has been used yet.

status.name: Power Swap
status.effect: User swaps its Attack and Special Attack stat modifiers modifiers with the target.
status.desc: The user employs its psychic power to switch changes to its Attack and Sp. Atk stats with the target.

status.name: Guard Swap
status.effect: User swaps its Defense and Special Defense modifiers with the target.
status.desc: The user employs its psychic power to switch changes to its Defense and Sp. Def stats with the target.

status.name: Worry Seed
status.effect: Changes the target's ability to insomnia. If the target's ability is truant or multitype, this move will fail.
status.desc: A seed that causes worry is planted on the target. It prevents sleep by making the target’s Ability Insomnia.

status.name: Toxic Spikes
status.effect: Scatters poisoned spikes around the opposing field, which poison opposing Pokémon that enter the field. A second layer of these spikes may be laid down, in which case Pokémon will be badly poisoned instead. Pokémon immune to either ground moves or being poisoned are immune to this effect. Pokémon otherwise immune to ground moves are affected during gravity. If a poison Pokémon not immune to ground moves enters a field covered with poisoned spikes, the spikes are removed. rapid spin will remove this effect from its user's side of the field. defog will remove this effect from its target's side of the field. This move does not trigger synchronize, unless the Pokémon with synchronize was forced to enter the field by another effect such as roar. Pokémon entering the field due to baton pass are not affected by this effect.
status.desc: The user lays a trap of poison spikes at the feet of the opposing team. The spikes will poison opposing Pokémon that switch into battle.

status.name: Heart Swap
status.effect: User swaps its stat modifiers with the target.
status.desc: The user employs its psychic power to switch stat changes with the target.

status.name: Aqua Ring
status.effect: Restores 1/16 of the user's max HP at the end of each turn. If the user leaves the field, this effect ends. This effect is passed on by baton pass.
status.desc: The user envelops itself in a veil made of water. It regains some HP every turn.

status.name: Magnet Rise
status.effect: For five turns, the user is immune to ground moves. If the user is under the effect of ingrain or has levitate, this move will fail. This effect is temporarily disabled by and cannot be used during gravity. This effect is passed on by baton pass.
status.desc: The user levitates using electrically generated magnetism for five turns.

status.name: Rock Polish
status.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.
status.desc: The user polishes its body to reduce drag. This can sharply raise the Speed stat.

status.name: Switcheroo
status.effect: User and target permanently swap held items. Works even if one of the Pokémon isn't holding anything. If either Pokémon is holding mail, this move will fail. If either Pokémon has multitype or sticky hold, this move will fail. If this move results in a Pokémon obtaining choice band, choice scarf, or choice specs, and that Pokémon was the latter of the pair to move this turn, then the move it used this turn becomes its chosen forced move. This applies even if both Pokémon had a choice item before this move was used. If the first of the two Pokémon gains a choice item, it may select whatever choice move it wishes next turn. Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle. This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
status.desc: The user trades held items with the target faster than the eye can follow.

status.name: Nasty Plot
status.effect: Raises the user's Special Attack by two stages.
status.desc: The user stimulates its brain by thinking bad thoughts. This sharply raises the user’s Sp. Atk stat.

status.name: Defog
status.effect: Lowers the target's evasion by one stage. Clears away fog. Removes the effects of mist, light screen, reflect, safeguard, spikes, stealth rock, and toxic spikes from the target's side of the field. If the target is protected by mist, it will prevent the evasion change, then be removed by this move.
status.desc: A strong wind blows away the target’s barriers such as Reflect or Light Screen. This also lowers the target’s evasiveness.

status.name: Trick Room
status.effect: For five turns (including this one), slower Pokémon will act before faster Pokémon. Move priority is not affected. Using this move when its effect is already active will end the effect. Pokémon holding full incense, lagging tail, or quick claw and Pokémon with stall ignore this effect.
status.desc: The user creates a bizarre area in which slower Pokémon get to move first for five turns.

status.name: Captivate
status.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages. If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.
status.desc: If any opposing Pokémon is the opposite gender of the user, it is charmed, which harshly lowers its Sp. Atk stat.

status.name: Stealth Rock
status.effect: Spreads sharp rocks around the opposing field, damaging any Pokémon that enters the field for 1/8 its max HP. This damage is affected by the entering Pokémon's susceptibility to rock moves. rapid spin removes this effect from its user's side of the field.
status.desc: The user lays a trap of levitating stones around the opposing team. The trap hurts opposing Pokémon that switch into battle.

status.name: Defend Order
status.effect: Raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage.
status.desc: The user calls out its underlings to shield its body, raising its Defense and Sp. Def stats.

status.name: Heal Order
status.effect: Heals the user for half its max HP.
status.desc: The user calls out its underlings to heal it. The user regains up to half of its max HP.

status.name: Lunar Dance
status.effect: User faints. Its replacement's HP and PP are fully restored, and any major status effect is removed.
status.desc: The user faints. In return, the Pokémon taking its place will have its status and HP fully restored.

status.name: Dark Void
status.effect: Puts the target to sleep.
status.desc: Opposing Pokémon are dragged into a world of total darkness that makes them sleep.

status.name: Hone Claws
status.effect: Raises the user's Attack and accuracy by one stage.
status.desc: The user sharpens its claws to boost its Attack stat and accuracy.

status.name: Wide Guard
status.effect: Moves with multiple targets will not hit friendly Pokémon for the remainder of this turn. If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail. This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
status.desc: The user and its allies are protected from wide ranging attacks for one turn.

status.name: Guard Split
status.effect: Averages the user's unmodified Defense with the target's unmodified Defense; the value becomes the unmodified Defense for both Pokémon. Unmodified Special Defense is averaged the same way.
status.desc: The user employs its psychic power to average its Defense and Sp. Def stats with those of the target.

status.name: Power Split
status.effect: Averages the user's unmodified Attack with the target's unmodified Attack; the value becomes the unmodified Attack for both Pokémon. Unmodified Special Attack is averaged the same way. This effect applies before any other persistent changes to unmodified Attack or Special Attack, such as flower gift during sunny day.
status.desc: The user employs its psychic power to average its Attack and Sp. Atk stats with those of the target.

status.name: Wonder Room
status.effect: For five turns (including this one), every Pokémon's Defense and Special Defense are swapped.
status.desc: The user creates a bizarre area in which Pokémon’s Defense and Sp. Def stats are swapped for five turns.

status.name: Autotomize
status.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages. Halves the user's weight; this effect does not stack.
status.desc: The user sheds part of its body to make itself lighter and sharply raise its Speed stat.

status.name: Rage Powder
status.effect: Until the end of this turn, any moves that opposing Pokémon target solely at the user's ally will instead target the user. If both Pokémon on the same side of the field use this move on the same turn, the Pokémon that uses it last will become the target. This effect takes priority over lightning rod and storm drain. If the user's ally switches out, opposing Pokémon may still hit it with pursuit. This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
status.desc: The user scatters a cloud of irritating powder to draw attention to itself. Opponents aim only at the user.

status.name: Telekinesis
status.effect: For three turns (including this one), moves used against the target have 100% accuracy, but the target is immune to ground damage. Accuracy of one hit KO moves is exempt from this effect. This effect is removed by gravity. If Gravity is already in effect, this move will fail.
status.desc: The user makes the target float with its psychic power. The target is easier to hit for three turns.

status.name: Magic Room
status.effect: For five turns (including this one), passive effects of held items are ignored, and Pokémon will not use their held items.
status.desc: The user creates a bizarre area in which Pokémon’s held items lose their effects for five turns.

status.name: Quiver Dance
status.effect: Raises the user's Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by one stage each.
status.desc: The user lightly performs a beautiful, mystic dance. This boosts the user’s Sp. Atk, Sp. Def, and Speed stats.

status.name: Soak
status.effect: Changes the target to pure water type until it leaves the field. If the target has multitype, this move will fail.
status.desc: The user shoots a torrent of water at the target and changes the target’s type to Water.

status.name: Coil
status.effect: Raises the user's Attack, Defense, and accuracy by one stage each.
status.desc: The user coils up and concentrates. This raises its Attack and Defense stats as well as its accuracy.

status.name: Simple Beam
status.effect: Changes the target's ability to simple.
status.desc: The user’s mysterious psychic wave changes the target’s Ability to Simple.

status.name: Entrainment
status.effect: Changes the target's ability to match the user's. This effect ends when the target leaves battle.
status.desc: The user dances with an odd rhythm that compels the target to mimic it, making the target’s Ability the same as the user’s.

status.name: After You
status.effect: The target will act next this turn, regardless of Speed or move priority. If the target has already acted this turn, this move will fail.
status.desc: The user helps the target and makes it use its move right after the user.

status.name: Quick Guard
status.effect: Moves with priority greater than 0 will not hit friendly Pokémon for the remainder of this turn. If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail. This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
status.desc: The user protects itself and its allies from priority moves.

status.name: Ally Switch
status.effect: User switches position on the field with the friendly Pokémon opposite it. If the user is in the middle position in a triple battle, or there are no other friendly Pokémon, this move will fail.
status.desc: The user teleports using a strange power and switches places with one of its allies.

status.name: Shell Smash
status.effect: Raises the user's Attack, Special Attack, and Speed by two stages each. Lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each.
status.desc: The user breaks its shell, which lowers Defense and Sp. Def stats but sharply raises its Attack, Sp. Atk, and Speed stats.

status.name: Heal Pulse
status.effect: Heals the target for half its max HP.
status.desc: The user emits a healing pulse that restores the target’s HP by up to half of its max HP.

status.name: Shift Gear
status.effect: Raises the user's Attack by one stage and its Speed by two stages.
status.desc: The user rotates its gears, raising its Attack stat and sharply raising its Speed stat.

status.name: Quash
status.effect: Forces the target to act last this turn, regardless of Speed or move priority. If the target has already acted this turn, this move will fail.
status.desc: The user suppresses the target and makes its move go last.

status.name: Reflect Type
status.effect: User's type changes to match the target's.
status.desc: The user reflects the target’s type, making it the same type as the target.

status.name: Bestow
status.effect: Transfers the user's held item to the target. If the user has no held item, or the target already has a held item, this move will fail.
status.desc: The user passes its held item to the target when the target isn’t holding an item.

status.name: Work Up
status.effect: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.
status.desc: The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk stats increase.

status.name: Cotton Guard
status.effect: Raises the user's Defense by three stages.
status.desc: The user protects itself by wrapping its body in soft cotton, which drastically raises the user’s Defense stat.

status.name: Mat Block
status.effect: Protects all friendly Pokémon from damaging moves. Only works on the first turn after the user is sent out.
status.desc: Using a pulled up mat as a shield, the user protects itself and its allies from damaging moves. This does not stop status moves.

status.name: Rototiller
status.effect: Raises the Attack and Special Attack of all grass Pokémon in battle.
status.desc: Tilling the soil, the user makes it easier for plants to grow. This raises the Attack and Sp. Atk stats of Grass type Pokémon.

status.name: Sticky Web
status.effect: Shoots a web over the opponents' side of the field, which lowers the Speed of any opposing Pokémon that enters the field by one stage. Pokémon in the air, such as flying types and those with levitate, are unaffected. rapid spin removes Sticky Web from the user's side of the field; defog removes it from both sides.
status.desc: The user weaves a sticky net around the opposing team, which lowers their Speed stat upon switching into battle.

status.name: Trick Or Treat
status.effect: Adds ghost to the target's types.
status.desc: The user takes the target trick or treating. This adds Ghost type to the target’s type.

status.name: Noble Roar
status.effect: Lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by one stage.
status.desc: Letting out a noble roar, the user intimidates the target and lowers its Attack and Sp. Atk stats.

status.name: Ion Deluge
status.effect: Changes all Pokémon's normal moves to electric moves for the rest of the turn.
status.desc: The user disperses electrically charged particles, which changes Normal type moves to Electric type moves.

status.name: Forests Curse
status.effect: Adds grass to the target's types.
status.desc: The user puts a forest curse on the target. The target is now Grass type as well.

status.name: Parting Shot
status.effect: Lowers all targets' Attack and Special Attack by one stage. Makes the user switch out.
status.desc: With a parting threat, the user lowers the target’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats. Then it switches with a party Pokémon.

status.name: Topsy Turvy
status.effect: Inverts the target's stat modifiers.
status.desc: All stat changes affecting the target turn topsy turvy and become the opposite of what they were.

status.name: Crafty Shield
status.effect: Protects all friendly Pokémon from non damaging moves for the rest of the turn. Unlike other blocking moves, this move may be used consecutively without its chance of success falling.
status.desc: The user protects itself and its allies from status moves with a mysterious power. This does not stop moves that do damage.

status.name: Flower Shield
status.effect: Raises the Defense of all grass Pokémon in battle.
status.desc: The user raises the Defense stat of all Grass type Pokémon in battle with a mysterious power.

status.name: Grassy Terrain
status.effect: For five turns, heals all Pokémon on the ground for 1/16 their max HP each turn and strengthens their grass moves to 1.5× their power. Changes nature power to energy ball.
status.desc: The user turns the ground to grass for five turns. This restores the HP of Pokémon on the ground a little every turn and powers up Grass type moves.

status.name: Misty Terrain
status.effect: For five turns, protects all Pokémon on the ground from major status ailments and confusion and weakens dragon moves used against them to 0.5× their power. Changes nature power to moonblast.
status.desc: This protects Pokémon on the ground from status conditions and halves damage from Dragon type moves for five turns.

status.name: Electrify
status.effect: Changes the target's move's type to electric if it hasn't moved yet this turn.
status.desc: If the target is electrified before it uses a move during that turn, the target’s move becomes Electric type.

status.name: Fairy Lock
status.effect: Prevents all Pokémon from fleeing or switching out during the next turn.
status.desc: By locking down the battlefield, the user keeps all Pokémon from fleeing during the next turn.

status.name: Kings Shield
status.effect: Blocks damaging attacks and lowers attacking Pokémon's Attack by two stages on contact. Switches Aegislash to Shield Forme.
status.desc: The user takes a defensive stance while it protects itself from damage. It also harshly lowers the Attack stat of any attacker who makes direct contact.

status.name: Play Nice
status.effect: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.
status.desc: The user and the target become friends, and the target loses its will to fight. This lowers the target’s Attack stat.

status.name: Confide
status.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.
status.desc: The user tells the target a secret, and the target loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.

status.name: Spiky Shield
status.effect: Blocks damaging attacks and damages attacking Pokémon for 1/8 their max HP.
status.desc: In addition to protecting the user from attacks, this move also damages any attacker who makes direct contact.

status.name: Aromatic Mist
status.effect: Raises a selected ally's Special Defense by one stage.
status.desc: The user raises the Sp. Def stat of an ally Pokémon by using a mysterious aroma.

status.name: Eerie Impulse
status.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.
status.desc: The user’s body generates an eerie impulse. Exposing the target to it harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.

status.name: Venom Drench
status.effect: Lowers the target's Attack, Special Attack, and Speed by one stage if it is poisoned.
status.desc: Opposing Pokémon are drenched in an odd poisonous liquid. This lowers the Attack, Sp. Atk, and Speed stats of a poisoned target.

status.name: Powder
status.effect: Explodes if the target uses a fire move this turn, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP and preventing the move.
status.desc: The user covers the target in a combustible powder. If the target uses a Fire type move, the powder explodes and damages the target.

status.name: Geomancy
status.effect: Takes one turn to charge, then raises the user's Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by two stages.
status.desc: The user absorbs energy and sharply raises its Sp. Atk, Sp. Def, and Speed stats on the next turn.

status.name: Magnetic Flux
status.effect: Raises the Defense and Special Defense of all friendly Pokémon with plus or minus by one stage.
status.desc: The user manipulates magnetic fields, which raises the Defense and Sp. Def stats of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus Ability.

status.name: Happy Hour
status.effect: Doubles prize money. Stacks with a held item. Only works once per battle.
status.desc: Using Happy Hour doubles the amount of prize money received after battle.

status.name: Electric Terrain
status.effect: For five turns, prevents all Pokémon on the ground from sleeping and strengthens their electric moves to 1.5× their power. Changes nature power to thunderbolt.
status.desc: The user electrifies the ground for five turns, powering up Electric type moves. Pokémon on the ground no longer fall asleep.

status.name: Celebrate
status.effect: Does nothing.
status.desc: The Pokémon congratulates you on your special day!

status.name: Hold Hands
status.effect: Does nothing.
status.desc: The user and an ally hold hands. This makes them very happy.

status.name: Baby Doll Eyes
status.effect: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.
status.desc: The user stares at the target with its baby doll eyes, which lowers its Attack stat. This move always goes first.

status.name: Shore Up
status.effect: Heals the user for ½ its max HP. During a sandstorm, the healing is increased to ⅔.
status.desc: The user regains up to half of its max HP. It restores more HP in a sandstorm.

status.name: Baneful Bunker
status.effect: Grants the user protection for the rest of the turn. If a Pokémon attempts to use a move that makes contact with the user, that Pokémon will be poisoned. This move's chance of success halves every time it's used consecutively with any other protection move.
status.desc: In addition to protecting the user from attacks, this move also poisons any attacker that makes direct contact.

status.name: Floral Healing
status.effect: Heals the target for ½ its max HP. If grassy terrain is in effect, heals for ⅔ instead.
status.desc: The user restores the target’s HP by up to half of its max HP. It restores more HP when the terrain is grass.

status.name: Strength Sap
status.effect: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage. Heals the user by the target's current Attack, including modifiers, but not including this move's Attack lowering effect. If the target's Attack is already at 6, this move will fail. In any other situation that would prevent a stat modification, the healing will still succeed.
status.desc: The user restores its HP by the same amount as the target’s Attack stat. It also lowers the target’s Attack stat.

status.name: Spotlight
status.effect: For the duration of the turn, if the target is also a valid target for a move used by one of its opponents, that move will target it instead.
status.desc: The user shines a spotlight on the target so that only the target will be attacked during the turn.

status.name: Toxic Thread
status.effect: Poisons the target and lowers its Speed by one stage.
status.desc: The user shoots poisonous threads to poison the target and lower the target’s Speed stat.

status.name: Laser Focus
status.effect: The user's next move will result in a critical hit.
status.desc: The user concentrates intensely. The attack on the next turn always results in a critical hit.

status.name: Gear Up
status.effect: Raises the Attack and Special Attack of all friendly Pokémon with plus or minus by one stage.
status.desc: The user engages its gears to raise the Attack and Sp. Atk stats of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus Ability.

status.name: Psychic Terrain
status.effect: Changes the terrain to Psychic Terrain for 5 turns. Overrides electric terrain, grassy terrain, and misty terrain. All Pokémon on the ground are immune to moves with priority greater than 0. (Moves that target the field rather than individual Pokémon, such as spikes, are not affected.) Additionally, when a Pokémon on the ground uses a psychic type move, that move's power is increased to 1.5×. If a Pokémon is holding a Terrain Extender when creating Psychic Terrain (by any means), the effect lasts for 8 turns instead of 5.
status.desc: This protects Pokémon on the ground from priority moves and powers up Psychic type moves for five turns.

status.name: Speed Swap
status.effect: Exchanges the original Speed stats of the user and target.
status.desc: The user exchanges Speed stats with the target.

status.name: Purify
status.effect: Cures the target of its major status ailment and heals the user for 50% of its max HP. If the target has no major status ailment, this move will fail.
status.desc: The user heals the target’s status condition. If the move succeeds, it also restores the user’s own HP.

status.name: Instruct
status.effect: The target immediately uses its most recently used move. This is independent of the target's normal action for the turn (i.e., it may end up moving twice), but otherwise functions as usual, including deduction of PP. This effect works for disabled moves and ignores torment.
status.desc: The user instructs the target to use the target’s last move again.

status.name: Aurora Veil
status.effect: Places the Aurora Veil effect on the user's side of the field for the next 5 turns. If the weather is not hail, or the weather is disabled by the effects of cloud nine or air lock, this move will fail. Any regular damage dealt to an affected Pokémon is reduced by ½. (If there are multiple Pokémon on the affected field, the reduction is ⅓.)
status.desc: This move reduces damage from physical and special moves for five turns. This can be used only in a hailstorm.

status.name: Extreme Evoboost
status.effect: Raises the user's Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by two stages each.
status.desc: After obtaining Z Power, the user, Eevee, gets energy from its evolved friends and boosts its stats sharply.

status.name: Tearful Look
status.effect: Lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.
status.desc: The user gets teary eyed to make the target lose its combative spirit. This lowers the target’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
